Description: Fragmentary part of a tunic in undyed linen, plain weave; with a waist tuck in the middle with a run-and-fell seam with oversewing; above the seam two clavus in tapestry are applied and sewn, on the lower part of the clavus are finials ending in circular medallions; each is decorated with a stylised motif (tree? flower?), the main bands are decorated with stylised winged erotes, surrounded by fish and vegetal elements (Nilotic scene) on a red background and are framed with a freize of multi-coloured geometric motifs on a black background; the edges of the tapestry are hemmed under; the plain weave is very damaged and the edges are cut and ragged and the fabric is preserved as two different pieces; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/12), weft-undyed linen (S/9); sewing: undyed linen (S spun Z ply); tapestry on grouped threads: warp- undyed linen (S spun Z ply/13), weft-undyed linen (S/48), undyed, yellow, pink, red, green, light and dark blue and black wool (S/76)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
